timeline.bodyText: is "YetToEnroll" status not needed here? how do you display participants that have tokens generated for them but have not yet joined then?
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -14,8 +14,6 @@
 public enum ParticipantStudyStateStatus {
   ENROLLED("Enrolled"),
   WITHDRAWN("Withdrawn"),
-  INPROGRESS("inProgress"),
-  YETTOJOIN("yetToJoin"),

replies.bodyText: ParticipantStudyStateStatus enum is unused, hence removed
replies.author: Kantharajut-btc

timeline.bodyText:
there is a change in logic here that is not explained:


why is  enrollmentStatus set to EnrollmentStatus.YET_TO_ENROLL.getDisplayValue()? is it supposed to be a status or a display value? I am guessing those two are not the same thing.
for other cases you are directly setting this to studyParticipantDetail.getEnrolledStatus(), why is yet_to_enroll` case treated differentky?


you are not setting enrollmentDate to null when participant is in yet to enroll status anymore. why is this changed?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
Yet to enroll – currently this value is being directly displayed in PM web app Front End  based on Onboarding status. Now this value will be read from database directly, similar to other statuses. now while adding the participant to site will add the record in participant_study_info as well with enrollemnt status as  Yet to enroll  and enrollment date as null (please refer PR #2346)
If the participant is Yet to enroll then Enrolled date will be null in DB, hence showing NA for enrolled date for site participants and study participants to maintain consistency
Modified EnrollmentStatus enum to get the display value based on status
replies.author: Kantharajut-btc

timeline.bodyText: same as above, change in logic is not explained. e.g. enrollmentDate is now being set to NOT_APPLICABLE instead of null for other cases. Setting a date to enum seems wrong and unintuitive; is there any tests to test these scenarios and make sure the app works as expected?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: If the participant is Yet to enroll then Enrolled date will be null in DB, hence showing NA for enrolled date for site participants and study participants to maintain consistency, modified existing tests for new status changes
replies.author: Kantharajut-btc

timeline.author: github-actions
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -223,7 +223,7 @@ public String getUserInfoDetails(String userId) {
           session
               .createSQLQuery(
                   "SELECT sp.study_info_id, GROUP_CONCAT(a.device_token) as device_token,GROUP_CONCAT(a.device_type) as device_type FROM participant_study_info sp, auth_info a"
-                      + " where sp.user_details_id = a.user_details_id and sp.status not in('yetToJoin','withdrawn','notEligible') and a.remote_notification_flag=1"
+                      + " where sp.user_details_id = a.user_details_id and sp.status not in('yetToEnroll','withdrawn','notEligible') and a.remote_notification_flag=1"
